body: Sorry it took me a couple days. I was busy and saved the email notification then promptly forgot about it. Thank you for the fix.
This version doesn't actually work.  Closing and resubmitting.

Ah dang, I'm sorry to have created more work for you guys. I already had the tests completed and working but was out of service for a couple days. I'll try not to leave the repo in such a state in the future.
Yeah sorry about the tests, that was my fault. Left the repo in a poor state before going on a weekend vacation. Thanks for the contribution! Looks great, and I agree that camel case is valuable.

I believe [this line](https://github.com/chevex/yargs/blob/master/index.js#L180) was added by substack for that very reason. Try using `defaults` instead of `default` as I believe it is the same method with a different name for that exact reason.

Please close this issue if that resolves it :)

[Confirmed.](https://github.com/chevex/yargs/commit/1bd4375e11327ba1687d4bb6e5e9f3c30c1be2af)

I am closing since I confirmed that was the fix for this issue in the past. Feel free to reopen if you have anymore issues.
Oh, cool, I didn't know about that - thanks!
No problem. Enjoy :)

I believe that method was originally used to demand a certain number of non-hyphenated options, but later the demand method was modified to detect if a number was passed in. If a number is passed to demand then it should behave as demandCount used to. Try simply substituting demand for demandCount. Let me know if that does what you expect. I'll close this when I get to a computer and fix the example.
Yep `.demand` behaves in the expected way. I'll close this ticket.
Cheers!
Realized I could just edit the file right on GitHub. I'll publish to npm later. Thanks for the report :)
Thanks for merging!  Can you push a version with this change to npm?
Done. v1.2.0 has your changes :)
Well... now that you pushed a version... I found a bug.  :/  Sorry, and see #10
No worries. v1.2.1 has the fix.
Thanks!

If you're reading [the Yargs documentation](https://github.com/chevex/yargs#after-yer-demands-have-been-met-demand-more-ask-for-non-hypenated-arguments) then the documentation is correct. The method was changed long ago from `demandCount` to just another overload of `demand` if you pass it a number. I don't see a call to `demandCount` in the README.
Ah. I was using the documentation on https://www.npmjs.org/package/yargs

Oh interesting. Good catch. The anomaly in the docs must have been fixed recently then. We haven't published a code update to npm in a while so the README probably just hasn't gone up there. I'll throw out a quick patch :)
Cool, I'll just have to make a habit of checking Github in addition then!

Thanks, this fixes the issue.  I'm going to recommend my #21 instead though, because it fixes #7 and #20 and there's a conflict between the two fixes, and it has more tests.  (My PR incorporates your fix because it's cleaner than the way I originally did it.)
Fix at #21
Confirmed; fix at #21

Also, your last two failures are not a problem - you need to specify that the option is a boolean, otherwise yargs will (correctly) interpret `--flag extra` as setting the value of the `flag` option to the string `extra`.
Great.

> Confirmed; fix at #21 

Thanks!

> Also, your last two failures are not a problem - you need to specify that the option is a boolean, otherwise yargs will (correctly) interpret --flag extra as setting the value of the flag option to the string extra.

Makes sense. I don't remember why did I construct the test cases in this specific way, it's entirely possible the last two failures were expected.
Thanks!
Thanks for this :+1:
